Title: Requires human service providers that contract with the state to pay their employees a minimum wage of twenty-one dollars per hour
Summary: Requires that the rate of pay for all human services contracts between any state or local agency and a nonprofit human services provider stipulate that the provider will pay its employees no less than twenty-one dollars per hour and that the necessary amounts have been appropriated to ensure payment of such minimum wage.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to requiring human service providers that contract with the state to pay their employees a minimum wage of twenty-one dollars per hour
